text: Head to the Exalting Sanctum Plaza whenever you are ready.

title: Mission Description
content: Fu XuantookKafkato the Divination Commission but asked you to wait. The Xianzhou Luofu is in troubled times, and everyone feels trapped in place.You take this chance to stroll around the area and wait for the Divination Commission's messenger to arrive.

text:
(Approach middle of plaza)
(Open phone to message from ???)
??? Greetings, Master Diviner asked me to wait for you. It's about time. Can't go. Busy right now.

speaker: March 7th
line: What does that mean? It's just a picture. Are we supposed to meet someone there?

speaker: March 7th
line: It's like one of those messages a kidnapper sends in a horror movie...

speaker: Welt
line: That's enough of that. Come on, let's go.

text: Using the photo you received on your phone to find the waiting messenger

title: Step Description
content: Fu Xuan took Kafka to the Divination Commission but asked you to wait. The Xianzhou Luofu is in troubled times, and everyone feels trapped in place.The Divination Commission's messenger is late. Perhaps she, too, is hindered by troublesome business. Maybe it's best to actively go and find her.

text: (Approach the area shown in the photo)

speaker: Player in the South Seat
line: Hurry up, Qingque ! We'll be fossils by the time you're finished.

speaker: Player in the West Seat
line: I heard there was a disaster in the Divination Commission 's delve? I'm surprised you're in the mood to play right now, Qingque.

speaker: Qingque
line: Even if the sky was gonna collapse on the Divination Commission, the master diviner would be there to hold it up. What she lacks in height, she more than makes up for in stamina.

speaker: Qingque
line: Anyway, I didn't come here just to play — she ordered me to wait here for our guests. Time is precious! I'm simply multitasking.

speaker: March 7th
line: It's the place in the photo alright. Is this... a games parlor!? What kind of problem can they possibly be facing?

speaker: Qingque
line: Ha! Isn't this hand a problem? I have the worst luck...

speaker: Qingque
line: Hi there! I can tell just by looking at you that you're the Divination Commission's guests.

text: Did you bring us here just for this?
Do you even know how long we've been waiting!?
You don't want the master diviner to know you've been slacking off, do you?

speaker: Qingque
line: I know, I know, I'm sorry — I was going to wait for you by the statue, but— Ah— Triplet!

speaker: Qingque
line: ...but folks from the Realm-Keeping Commission descended on the area. It's too loud over there now... Pass! Pass!

speaker: Qingque
line: ...So I thought to myself, wouldn't it be better to meet somewhere quieter? FOUR OF A KIND!

speaker: Qingque
line: ...And wouldn't that be more fun, too? Better to show you the real Exalting Sanctum and introduce you to a true Xianzhou pastime: Celestial jade . Aha...

speaker: Qingque
line: Victory!

speaker: Qingque
line: *sigh* Now that my wish has been fulfilled, there's nothing holding us back. Follow me, honored guests.

title: Step Description
content: You finally meet up with Qingque, the messenger from the Divination Commission. She is indeed "trapped in place" as she ponders how to play her tiles in hand. You can't help but think the master diviner has interesting tastes in hiring staff.Qingque's luck in the game drastically improves as soon as you arrive, and she happily starts to fulfill her duty as your guide.

speaker: Qingque
line: I must apologize for your long wait, honored guests.

speaker: Welt
line: It wasn't too long. Seeing your enthusiasm for this "celestial jade" game has stoked my curiosity.

speaker: Qingque
line: Haha, I'm glad to hear it — you clearly have excellent taste! If you're interested I can show you how to play — it's great fun.

speaker: Welt
line: Sure!

speaker: March 7th
line: Mr. Yang! Is this really the best time?

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), look! Is that a...?

speaker: Tingyun
line: It's an ancient tree — we call it the Ambrosial Arbor . It was once the Xianzhou Luofu's prized treasure.

speaker: Qingque
line: I didn't know the Sky-Faring Commission were history buffs! Not bad, younger generations usually don't know much about it. It's said that the Ambrosial Arbor is an ancient remnant from when the Xianzhou roamed the ether.

speaker: Qingque
line: From a distance it looks like half a tree stump, but according to Records of the Early Nation , in its prime, "it wound into the heavens, and from it celestial bodies hung!"

speaker: March 7th
line: Meaning...?

speaker: Welt
line: It means the tree was as tall as the sky and stars hung from its branches.

speaker: March 7th
line: So how big was it? Bigger than the Express ? Bigger than Herta space station ? No, that can't be right.

speaker: March 7th
line: "Stars hung from its branches..." Then how did it fit in the Xianzhou!?

text: Technically, any tree in the spaceship fits this description.

children.speaker: Qingque
children.line: Those are metaphors! You shouldn't take poetry so literally.

text: It sounds like an unimaginably magnificent tree.

children.speaker: Qingque
children.line: Exactly, let's just say it was bigger than your imagination.

speaker: Qingque
line: Anyway, it's just a legend. I see this view every day on my way to work — I'm kinda bored of it.

speaker: Qingque
line: Let's go.

speaker: Qingque
line: We're almost there everyone, stay close.
